Sentence.sentence: No wonder parents worry their own kids might spin out of control once they hit the turbulent waters of adolescence.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The electronic industry is maturing even though no wonder products hit the market.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For a moment the other day, she thought she might have hit on a good one.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: While schools emphasize its usefulness-online research in class and instant polling of students, for example - a big part of the attraction is, undoubtedly, that the iPhone is cool and a hit with students.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Better skip dinner or hit the gym afterwards, with a cancer charity warning that some iced coffees contain as many calories as a hot dinner.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: As careers and vocations become less available during times of recession, adolescents may be especially hard hit.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: He laid off several hundred workers; especially hard hit were the blue- and pink-collar departments such as subscription fulfillment.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In 2008, Cuba was hit by five successive hurricanes, but only seven people were killed.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Island communities have been among the hardest hit by the threats facing the ocean, said President Tommy Remengesau Jr. in a statement.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: It's a huge hit around the world.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Overwork and exhaustion are the opposite of resilience and the bad habits we acquire when we're young only magnify when we hit the workforce.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: That means when a golfer tells himself "Don't hit the ball into the water", his mind sees the image of the ball flying into the water.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The researchers also note the recession hit some years before we see the beginning of the well-being drop, and before the steepest well-being decline, which occurred in 2013.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: There is another explanation that Twenge and her colleagues wanted to address: the impact of the great recession of 2007-2009, which hit a great number of American families and might be affecting adolescents.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Yet once they start growing, such plants seem not to retain the ability to hit the pause button on metabolism in their stems or leaves.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section B

means: high-density integration technology 高密度集成技术
homing intercept technology 寻的截击技术
high-density isolation technology 高密度隔离技术
Holtzman inkblot technique 霍尔兹曼墨迹术

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"打"之意。
means: beat ： 普通用词，含义广泛，指连续打击。游戏、竞赛或战争中作打败解。
strike ： 普通用词，多指急速或突然一次猛击。
hit ： 普通用词，常与strike换用，侧重有目标的猛击，强调用力击中。
thrash ： 侧重指用棍子或鞭子等痛打。

example.en: I have a long way to go, I'd better hit the bricks.
example.zh: 我要走很长一段路呢，我还是走吧。

example.en: Go on! Hit the pavemem! Get going!
He'll hit the bricks tomorrow，having been paroled.
example.zh: 他已经获得假释，明天就出狱。

example.en: Agree to our demands, or we hh the bricks.
example.zh: 答应我们的要求，否则我们就罢工。

example.en: Is Tracy hitting the dope again?
How are they hitting it off these days?
example.zh: 他们现在相处得怎么样？

example.en: They hit it off from the start.
example.zh: 他们从一开始就很合得来。

example.en: He hit it off with the whole class.

list.explanation: 出发，离开(尤指某人在骑上马时) 离开

example.en: I have to hit the trail before sunset.
example.zh: 我必须在日落之前动身离开

example.en: Jed hit the skids when he started drugging.
example.zh: 杰德一始吸毒，就走堕落了。

example.en: The business of our firm hit the skids when the dollar collapsed.
example.zh: 美元暴跌，我们公司的生意一落千丈。

example.en: Eventually they had hit the skids.

Sentence.sentence: As experts continue to study the science of risk-seeking, we'll continue to hit the mountains, the waves or the shallow end of the pool.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: At last I ended up hitting the set with my first, and it stopped working altogether.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Beatlemania hit New York on February 7, 1964.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: But it can quickly rise to something worse, when everyone starts hitting "reply all" to join in a long and unpleasant conversation.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: But Shelly-Ann was to prove that she was anything but a one-hit wonder.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: By feeding the ponies, tourists increase the risk of them getting hit by a car, and make them harder to gather during the area's annual pony drift (迁移).
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: In my first P.E. Class, the teacher required us to run laps and then hit a softball.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Early forms of cake were simply a kind of bread, so this tradition hits its roots in the custom of sharing bread.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: It gives you the chance to hit upon new ideas and recipes that can work well with your appetite and schedule.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: It hit me then: why, as a child, helping dad clean his comb was such a pleasure?
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It's about time they had to be registered and insured, so when they do hit a pedestrian or a vehicle, or cause an accident, at least they can be treated and there might be an opportunity to claim.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Scammers follow money, so companies will be the worst hit.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: That night, hurricane sandy attacked the east coast, and rockaway was hit especially hard.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The bus hit a lamp post and it broke the glass on the front door before Harvold managed to bring the bus to a stop.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The man-on-the-street interview is an interview in which a reporter hits the streets with a cameraman to interview people on the sport.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（6月） 阅读理解 七选五 原文

Sentence.sentence: Three days later, a hurricane hit the coast near cornwall.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Toknow magazine is a big hit in the world of children's publishing, bringing a unique combination of challenging ideas and good fun to young fans every month.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

abbreviation.mean_cn: 自动寻的截击导弹技术

Sentence.sentence: The sharp hit to growth predicted around the world and in the UK could lead to a decline in the everyday services we depend on for our well-being and for growth.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As many people hit middle age, they often start to notice that their memory and mental clarity are not what they used to be.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语一）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Gen Zs are about to hit the streets looking for work in a labor market that's tighter than it's been in decades.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Paris of opponents hit the ball back and forth until one winner emerges from all who entered.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: without question, manufacturing has taken a significant hit during recent decades, and further trade deals raise questions about whether new shocks could hit manufacturing.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: The boxer hits hard with his left.
sentences.cn: 拳击手用其左手狠狠出击。

sentences.en: The ball sprang back and hit him.
sentences.cn: 球弹回打在他身上。

sentences.en: The cars hit with loud crash.
sentences.cn: 汽车相撞发出巨大的轰隆声。

sentences.en: I hit a difficult point in my work, and decided it was time for a cup of tea.
sentences.cn: 我在工作中遇到了一个困难, 因此打算先喝杯茶休息一下。

sentences.en: They hit the enemy one hard blow after another.
sentences.cn: 他们给敌人一个又一个的沉重打击。

means.word_mean: 产生不良影响；打击；危害
遇到困难；经历不愉快的事情

sentences.en: Waves hit my boat off the shore.
sentences.cn: 波浪把我的小船冲离了海岸。

means.word_mean: (在精神上)打击(某人)，伤…的感情，使受痛苦(或损失)

sentences.en: Her son's death hits her greatly.
sentences.cn: 儿子的去世给她的打击十分沉重。

sentences.en: We hit a heavy rain when we returned from the National Park.
sentences.cn: 我们从国家公园返回时遇上了一场大雨。

sentences.en: Can you hit who will come to detail of us?
sentences.cn: 你能猜中谁要来给我们分派任务吗?

sentences.en: His remarks hit our views.
sentences.cn: 他所说的正道出了我们的观点。

sentences.en: His lecture hit the will of the most.
sentences.cn: 他的演讲迎合了大多数人的愿望。

sentences.en: Your report will be hit tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 你的报道明天见报。

sentences.en: The fish hits the hook at one swoop.
sentences.cn: 那条鱼一下子就咬住了钩

means.word_mean: 抨击，严厉批评；攻击(常与 out 连用)

sentences.en: Jim is still recovering from that hit on the head.
sentences.cn: 吉姆头上挨了一拳, 还没有完全清醒过来。

means.word_mean: 成功而风行一时的事物
命中（尤指互联网的一次访问）

sentences.en: The appearances show that a storm will hit at once.
sentences.cn: 这些现象表明一场暴风雪就要袭来。

means.word_mean: (偶然)碰上，找到，发现；(突然)想到(与 on， upon 连用)

sentences.en: The book on which he hit on my desk was one of the famous novels written by Jack London.
sentences.cn: 他无意间在我书桌上发现的那本书是杰克伦敦著名小说中的一本。</seg>

data.mean: 产生不良影响；打击；危害
hit on/upon sth 突然有个好主意；偶然想到妙点子

fixed_phrase_list.cn: 遭到破坏；收到严重影响

jx.jx_en_mean: To pay unsolicited and usually unwanted sexual attention to
jx.jx_cn_mean: （性）吸引地注意：对性吸引自发地且通常不受欢迎地注意

lj.lj_ly: can't go into a bar lately without being hit on.
lj.lj_ls: 最近只要去酒吧，没有不受到注意的

jx.jx_en_mean: To approach and ask (someone) for something, especially for money
jx.jx_cn_mean: 请求，要求：尤指接近并向（某人）索要金钱

lj.lj_ly: tried to hit me up for a loan.
picking a remedy can be a bit hit-and-miss.
lj.lj_ls: 挑选治疗法可能会有点随意性。

jx.jx_en_mean: denoting a person who causes accidental or wilful damage and escapes before being discovered, or damage caused in this way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 肇事（或故意损害）后逃跑的；肇事后逃跑造成的损失

lj.lj_ly: he was struck by a hit-and-run driver.
lj.lj_ls: 他被肇事后逃跑的司机撞的。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Boxing)(拳击)give one's opponent an illegal low blow
(informal)start something and proceed at a fast pace with enthusiasm
be successful in an attempt or accurate in a guess
as likely to be unsuccessful as successful
jx.jx_cn_mean: 可能成功也可能不成功，随意的

lj.lj_ls: 她的工作可能行也可能不行。
她的工作可能行也可能不行。

entry.def: If you hit someone or something, you deliberately touch them with a lot of force, with your hand or an object held in your hand.

example.ex: Find the exact grip that allows you to hit the ball hard...
example.tran: 找到能让你大力击球的准确握拍方法。

example.ex: She hit him hard across his left arm...
example.tran: 她狠狠地打在他的左臂上。

entry.def: When one thing hits another, it touches it with a lot of force.

example.ex: The car had apparently hit a traffic sign before skidding out of control...
example.tran: 汽车显然是撞上了一个交通标志牌后打滑失控的。

example.ex: She hit the last barrier and sprawled across the track.
example.tran: 她撞上了最后一个跨栏，整个人趴在了跑道上。

entry.def: If a bomb or missile hits its target, it reaches it.

example.ex: ...multiple-warhead missiles that could hit many targets at a time...
example.tran: 可一次击中多个目标的多弹头导弹

example.ex: The hospital had been hit with heavy artillery fire.

entry.def: If something hits a person, place, or thing, it affects them very badly.

example.ex: The plan to charge motorists £75 a year to use the motorway is going to hit me hard...
example.tran: 向汽车驾驶员每年收取75英镑高速公路使用费的计划将对我大为不利。

example.ex: About two-hundred people died in the earthquake which hit northern Peru...
example.tran: 约200人在秘鲁北部发生的地震中丧生。

entry.def: When a feeling or an idea hits you, it suddenly affects you or comes into your mind.

example.ex: It hit me that I had a choice...
example.tran: 我突然意识到我有选择的余地。

example.ex: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face.
example.tran: 然后我突然想到了答案，原来它一直就明摆在我的面前。

entry.def: If you hit a particular high or low point on a scale of something such as success or health, you reach it.

example.ex: He admits to having hit the lowest point in his life ...
example.tran: 他承认自己跌到了一生中的最低谷。

example.ex: Oil prices hit record levels yesterday.
example.tran: 油价昨天达到了创纪录的水平。

entry.def: If a CD, film, or play is a hit, it is very popular and successful.
entry.tran: 成功而轰动（或风行）一时的事物（如唱片、电影或戏剧）

example.ex: The song became a massive hit in 1945.
example.tran: 这首歌在1945年风靡大江南北。

example.ex: ...the surprise hit video of the year.
example.tran: 本年度出乎意料的热门视频

entry.def: A hit is a single visit to a website.

example.ex: Our small company has had 78,000 hits on its Internet pages.
example.tran: 我们这个小公司的因特网网页已经有了78,000次的点击量。

entry.def: If someone who is searching for information on the Internet gets a hit, they find a website where there is that information.
entry.tran: （在因特网上的）查询结果，检索结果

entry.def: If two people hit it off, they like each other and become friendly as soon as they meet.

example.ex: They hit it off straight away, Daddy and Walter...
example.tran: 爸爸和沃尔特很快就一见如故。

example.ex: How well did you hit it off with one another?

entry.def: If you make a hit with someone, they like you or are impressed by you when they meet you.
entry.tran: 大受欢迎;深受…的喜爱;令…印象深刻

example.ex: He made a hit with Lady Sopwith...
example.tran: 他深受索普威思太太的喜爱。

example.ex: She sends her best wishes — you've obviously made a hit there.
example.tran: 她向你问好——看得出来你在那里大受欢迎。

means.word_mean: 1. (baseball) a successful stroke in an athletic contest (especially in baseball);

sentences.sentence: "he came all the way around on Williams' hit"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of contacting one thing with another;

sentences.sentence: "repeated hitting raised a large bruise"
"after three misses she finally got a hit"
"that song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career"
"that new Broadway show is a real smasher"
"the party went with a bang"

means.word_mean: 4. (physics) an brief event in which two or more bodies come together;

sentences.sentence: "the collision of the particles resulted in an exchange of energy and a change of direction"

means.word_mean: 5. a dose of a narcotic drug
6. a murder carried out by an underworld syndicate;

sentences.sentence: "it has all the earmarks of a Mafia hit"

means.word_mean: 7. a connection made via the internet to another website;

sentences.sentence: "WordNet gets many hits from users worldwide"
"hit a ball"

means.word_mean: 2. hit against; come into sudden contact with;

sentences.sentence: "The car hit a tree"
"He struck the table with his elbow"

means.word_mean: 3. affect or afflict suddenly, usually adversely;

sentences.sentence: "We were hit by really bad weather"
"He was stricken with cancer when he was still a teenager"
"The earthquake struck at midnight"

means.word_mean: 4. deal a blow to, either with the hand or with an instrument;

sentences.sentence: "He hit her hard in the face"

means.word_mean: 5. reach a destination, either real or abstract;

sentences.sentence: "We hit Detroit by noon"
"The water reached the doorstep"
"We barely made it to the finish line"
"I have to hit the MAC machine before the weekend starts"

means.word_mean: 6. reach a point in time, or a certain state or level;

sentences.sentence: "The thermometer hit 100 degrees"
"This car can reach a speed of 140 miles per hour"

means.word_mean: 7. hit with a missile from a weapon

sentences.sentence: "Panic struck me"
"An interesting idea hit her"
"A thought came to me"
"The thought struck terror in our minds"
"They were struck with fear"

means.word_mean: 9. make a strategic, offensive, assault against an enemy, opponent, or a target;

sentences.sentence: "The Germans struck Poland on Sept. 1, 1939"
"We must strike the enemy's oil fields"
"in the fifth inning, the Giants struck, sending three runners home to win the game 5 to 2"

means.word_mean: 10. hit the intended target or goal
11. produce by manipulating keys or strings of musical instruments, also metaphorically;

sentences.sentence: "The pianist strikes a middle C"
"strike `z' on the keyboard"
"her comments struck a sour note"
"I stumbled across a long-lost cousin last night in a restaurant"
"The home team scored many times"
"He hit a home run"
"He hit .300 in the past season"
"hit the bottle"
"The mafia boss ordered his enemies murdered"

means.word_mean: 16. drive something violently into a location;

sentences.sentence: "he hit his fist on the table"
"she struck her head on the low ceiling"

means.word_mean: 17. pay unsolicited and usually unwanted sexual attention to;

sentences.sentence: "He tries to hit on women in bars"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English hittan (in the sense 'come upon, find'), from Old Norse hitta 'come upon, meet with', of unknown origin

sentences.cn: 台风要袭击我们的平台 吗 ?
sentences.en: Will the typhoon hit our rig?

sentences.cn: 亚洲海啸袭击了亚洲和非洲的14个国家.
sentences.en: The Asian tsunami hit 14 countries in Asia and Africa.

sentences.cn: 在周一一早,西里南海北部印度尼西亚的苏拉威西岛遭受7.5级地震袭击.
sentences.en: A 7.5 magnitude quake hit the Celebes Sea early Monday north of Indonesia's Sulawesi island.

sentences.cn: 在一次激励人心的讲话中，部长严厉抨击了军中的种族主义。
sentences.en: In a rousing speech the minister hit out at racism in the armed forces.

sentences.cn: 在一次令人振奋的讲话中, 总统对工会进行了猛烈的抨击.
sentences.en: In a rousing speech, the President hit out against the trade union.

sentences.cn: 选民们猛烈抨击政府最新决定.
sentences.en: The voters are hitting out at government latest decision.

sentences.cn: 现在这些批评家都抨击它.
sentences.en: Now da critics wanna hit it.

sentences.cn: 他对他们决定推迟花两百万建图书馆做出了猛烈抨击.
sentences.en: He hit out at their decision to delay spending two million on a new library.

sentences.cn: 普京抨击西方“不公平能源竞争 ”.
sentences.en: Putin hits at'unfair gas competition '.

sentences.cn: 报章评论抨击该新剧.
sentences.en: The reviews hit the new play.

sentences.cn: 有几位时事评论员猛烈抨击总统的对外政策.
sentences.en: Several news commentators hit out at the president on his foreign policy.

sentences.cn: 作者在书中猛烈地抨击了那些评论家.
sentences.en: The author hits out at his critics in his book.

sentences.cn: 他用调查报告猛烈抨击他们.
sentences.en: He had hit them hard with the investigation report.

sentences.cn: 演讲猛烈地抨击了战争贩子.
sentences.en: The speech hits out at warmongers.

sentences.cn: 抨击?呵~他们抨击只是因为他们 什么 都不了解.
sentences.en: This hit? How we did it, just because they don't get it.

sentences.cn: 出自大作家手笔的诗歌或散文能够给不公正的行为以猛烈的抨击.
sentences.en: Poems or essays that flow from the pen of great writer can hit injustice hard.

sentences.cn: 他的新小说因充斥着暴力和色情而受到猛烈的抨击.
sentences.en: His new novel hit out for full of violence and pornography.

sentences.cn: 他在演讲中猛烈抨击了死刑制.
sentences.en: He hit out in his lecture at the system of the penalty.

sentences.cn: 他做了一次猛烈抨击种族歧视的讲演.
sentences.en: He made a speech hitting out at racial discrimination.

sentences.cn: 瓦列里·博吉诺夫的经纪人再次猛烈抨击了尤文图斯.
sentences.en: Valeri Bojinov's agent has again hit out at Juventus.

sentences.cn: 一个人发怒对他来说就是倾向于抨击 、 咒骂等等.
sentences.en: A man to be angry is for him to be disposed to hit out, swear, etc.

sentences.cn: 夏立言因在台风来袭后不久签发了一封拒绝外援的信件而饱受抨击.
sentences.en: Hsia came under fire for issuing a letter declining foreign aid shortly after the typhoon hit.

sentences.cn: 他猛然抨击政府对无房人的政策.
sentences.en: He has hit out at the government's policy on homeless people.

sentences.cn: 选民猛烈抨击政府的最新决定.
sentences.en: The voters are hitting out at the government's latest decisions.

sentences.cn: 首相猛烈抨击他的同事.
sentences.en: The Prime Minister hit out at his colleagues.

sentences.cn: 他猛烈抨击史密斯先生.
sentences.en: He hit out at Mr. Smith.

sentences.cn: 他猛烈地抨击了国会.
sentences.en: He hit hard at the Congress.

sentences.cn: 总统借机猛烈抨击了被自己视为外国干涉的行为。
sentences.en: The President took the opportunity to hit out at what he sees as foreign interference.

sentences.cn: 昨天坎特伯雷大主教严厉抨击了几位与人通奸的公众人物。
sentences.en: The Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday hit out at public figures who commit adultery.

sentences.cn: 最近，安娜·福特对她认为阻碍了女性在电视业发展的男性集团进行了猛烈抨击。
sentences.en: Anna Ford recently hit out at the male clique which she believes holds back women in television.

sentences.cn: 我们旅行了几个星期, 初次碰上了暴风雪.
sentences.en: After several weeks of travel, snowstorm hit us first.

sentences.cn: 我们可能会碰上塞车.
sentences.en: We may hit a traffic jam.

sentences.cn: 我们碰上了接连不断的暴风雨.
sentences.en: We were hit with continuous storms.

sentences.cn: 飞机碰上气阱总是要下降一些的.
sentences.en: Every time a plane hits an air pocket, it always dips a little.

sentences.cn: 这样一来,随着发行利润的下降, 报纸就得依赖广告, 而这时又碰上了经济萧条.
sentences.en: As circulation revenue has declined, this made them dependent on advertising, just as the recession hit.

sentences.cn: 正当他叫我名字的时候我偶然碰上他了.
sentences.en: I hit him when he began to call me names.

sentences.cn: 这是一本难得的书,是在一个小书店碰上的.
sentences.en: It's a rare book. I hit upon it in a small bookshop.

sentences.cn: 碰上大家庭, 和父母住会引来不必要的麻烦.
sentences.en: Hit the extended family, and parents are bound to in unnecessary troubles.

sentences.cn: 抱歉, 我碰上尖峰时间的交通.
sentences.en: Sorry, I hit rush hour traffic.

sentences.cn: 船在航行时碰上了大雾.
sentences.en: The ship hit heavy fog on its voyage.

sentences.cn: 游艇碰上了礁石,撞坏了船头.
sentences.en: The yacht hit a rock and damaged her bows.

sentences.cn: 接着他又碰上了几条, 每碰上一条都像挨了清晰地一击.
sentences.en: A few more fish hit him, each one like a bolt of clarity.

sentences.cn: 如果碰上这样的交通状况大约也要一小时.
sentences.en: About the same if you hit the traffic.

sentences.cn: 然后我突然想到了答案，原来它一直就明摆在我的面前。
sentences.en: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face.

sentences.cn: 小明想到一个处理废水的好办法.
sentences.en: Xiaoming hit on a good idea to deal with the polluted water.

sentences.cn: 我想到一个主意.
sentences.en: An idea hit me.

sentences.cn: 她忽然想到一个好主意, 兴奋的睡不着.
sentences.en: She suddenly hit upon a good idea, which made her too excited to go to sleep.

sentences.cn: 最后他们想到了一个进行抢救的最好办法.
sentences.en: They finally hit on the best way to carry out the rescue.

sentences.cn: 我突然想到那些商店可能关门了.
sentences.en: It'suddenly hit me that the shops would be closed.

sentences.cn: 他想到一个新的计划.
sentences.en: He hit on a plan.

sentences.cn: 他想到去附近度假营过周末这个好主意.
sentences.en: He hit upon the good idea of spending the weekend in the nearby holiday camp.

sentences.cn: 最后他忽然想到一个可以适用于这种情况的好主意.
sentences.en: Finally he hit upon a good idea which could be applied to such a case.

sentences.cn: 我想到了一个主意.
sentences.en: I hit on an idea.

sentences.cn: 他经过一番思考,想到了一个打垮敌人的办法.
sentences.en: After some thought he hit on a plan to route the enemy.

sentences.cn: 许多好主意都是偶然想到的.
sentences.en: Many a bright idea has been hit on by accident.

sentences.cn: 他想到一个有趣的办法; 我想到一个方法.
sentences.en: Panic struck me; An interesting idea hit her; A thought came to me.

sentences.cn: 我们试过好几种办法,最后才忽然想到要这么干.
sentences.en: They tried several methods before they hit on this way of doing it.

sentences.cn: 在设计的主要特征上,他们俩想到一块儿去了.
sentences.en: They both hit upon the same idea for the main feature of their designs.

sentences.cn: 他突然为他的孙子想到了一个顶好的名字.
sentences.en: He hit upon a perfect name for his grandson.

sentences.cn: 达比一直在寻找改善铁质的方法，他猛然想到可以不用木炭熔炼，而改用焦炭。
sentences.en: Darby was looking for a way to improve iron when he hit upon the idea of smelting it with coke instead of charcoal.

sentences.cn: 然后我突然想到了答案，原来它一直就明摆在我的面前。
sentences.en: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face.

sentences.cn: 接着我突然想到了答案。从在路林顿起它就一直摆在我的眼前。
sentences.en: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face ever since Lullington.

Sentence.sentence: After Hurricane Katrina hit in 2005, mail facilities were set up in dozens of locations across the country in the two weeks that USPS was unable to provide street delivery.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: As universities go digital, students are complaining of a new hit to their finances that's replacing—and sometimes joining—expensive textbooks: pricey online access codes that are required to complete coursework and submit assignments.

Sentence.sentence: The Scottish Environment Protection Agency has issued more than 35 flood warnings covering several regions, as Scotland continues to clean up after Storm Frank hit the country last Wednesday.
